meanings.sent1: The forest became foggier as the mist rolled in.
meanings.sent2: The morning grew foggier as the sun struggled to break through the clouds.
meanings.sent3: Trying to find my way through the foggier path felt like a mysterious adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her memory of that day was foggier than a misty morning in the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The foggier landscape painted a dreamy scene before us.

meanings.definition: Unclear or hazy in appearance or understanding
meanings.sent1: The instructions on the old map were getting foggier with each passing year.
meanings.sent2: His memory of the event became foggier as time went on.
meanings.sent3: Trying to explain the complex concept to the kids left me feeling foggier than before.
meanings.sent4: The foggier details of the story added to its mysterious charm.
meanings.sent5: The foggier explanation only confused the students further.
